qas.question: What is listed as Chopin's official cause of death?
What was the name of Chopin's doctor?
What has the Polish government not allowed to find true cause of death?
What was the cause of death on Chopin's death certificate?
Other possiblities for Chopin's death include cirrhosis, alpha 1-antitrypsin deficiency, and what?
Who has denied testing Chopin's DNA to determine the actual cause of death?

context: Chopin's disease and the cause of his death have since been a matter of discussion. His death certificate gave the cause as <a0_0><a3_0>tuberculosis<a3_0/><a0_0/>, and his physician, <a1_0><a4_0>Jean Cruveilhier<a4_0/><a1_0/>, was then the leading French authority on this disease. Other possibilities have been advanced including <a5_0>cystic fibrosis<a5_0/>, cirrhosis and alpha 1-antitrypsin deficiency. However, the attribution of tuberculosis as principal cause of death has not been disproved. Permission for <a2_0>DNA testing<a2_0/>, which could put the matter to rest, has been denied by <a6_0>the Polish government.
